text:
Does anyone know of more tweets/blogs/posts like this: <https://twitter.com/fchollet/status/1364049204897701892>
I need to convince several C level employees of something and have to present some demos and stuff (powered by Julia of course)

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/fchollet|@fchollet>: The organization that produces the software is more valuable than the software itself. That's what your real product is. Polish it
attachments.text: The organization that produces the software is more valuable than the software itself. That's what your real product is. Polish it

elements.text: Does anyone know of more tweets/blogs/posts like this:
I need to convince several C level employees of something and have to present some demos and stuff (powered by Julia of course)

text: There was a blog post on hacker news which claimed that there is no reason to protect code as a potential competitor would not be able to further develop it due to lack of understanding of human relations of organization which made the code. If relevant I could try to find it.
